Let T\TT denote the unit circle in the complex plane and let P(T)\mathcal{P}\p{\T}P(T) denote the space of Borel probability measures on T\TT and P(T×T)\mathcal{P}\p{\T \times \T}P(T×T) denote the space of Borel probability measures on T×T\T \times \TT×T. Fix μ,ν∈P(T)\mu, \nu \in \mathcal{P}\p{\T}μ,ν∈P(T) and define

M={γ∈P(T×T) | ∬T×Tf(x)g(y) dγ(x,y)=(∫Tf(x) dμ(x))(∫Tg(y) dμ(y)) for all f,g∈C(T)}.\mathcal{M} = \set{\gamma \in \mathcal{P}\p{\T \times \T} \st \iint_{\T \times \T} f\p{x}g\p{y} \,\diff\gamma\p{x, y} = \p{\int_\T f\p{x} \,\diff\mu\p{x}}\p{\int_\T g\p{y} \,\diff\mu\p{y}} \text{ for all } f, g \in C\p{\T}}.M={γ∈P(T×T)∣∣​∬T×T​f(x)g(y)dγ(x,y)=(∫T​f(x)dμ(x))(∫T​g(y)dμ(y)) for all f,g∈C(T)}.

Show that F ⁣:M→R\func{F}{\mathcal{M}}{\R}F:M→R defined by

F(γ)=∬T×Tsin⁡2(θ−φ2) dγ(eiθ,eiφ)F\p{\gamma} = \iint_{\T \times \T} \sin^2\p{\frac{\theta - \phi}{2}} \,\diff\gamma\p{e^{i\theta}, e^{i\phi}}F(γ)=∬T×T​sin2(2θ−φ​)dγ(eiθ,eiφ)

achieves its minimum on M\mathcal{M}M.
Solution.

Observe that M={μ⊗ν}\mathcal{M} = \set{\mu \otimes \nu}M={μ⊗ν}. Indeed, given γ∈M\gamma \in \mathcal{M}γ∈M, we see that γ=μ⊗ν\gamma = \mu \otimes \nuγ=μ⊗ν (viewed as elements of (C(T×T))∗\p{C\p{\T \times \T}}^*(C(T×T))∗) agree on the set

A={∑k=1nckf(x)g(y) | n∈N, ck∈R, f,g∈C(T)}.A = \set{\sum_{k=1}^n c_k f\p{x} g\p{y} \st n \in \N,\ c_k \in \R,\ f, g \in C\p{\T}}.A={k=1∑n​ck​f(x)g(y)∣∣​n∈N, ck​∈R, f,g∈C(T)}.

By Stone-Weierstrass, this set is dense in C(T×T)C\p{\T \times \T}C(T×T), and so γ=μ⊗ν\gamma = \mu \otimes \nuγ=μ⊗ν everywhere in (C(T×T))∗\p{C\p{\T \times \T}}^*(C(T×T))∗, so by Riesz representation, it follows that γ=μ⊗ν\gamma = \mu \otimes \nuγ=μ⊗ν, so M\mathcal{M}M is a singleton. Thus, because

∣sin⁡2(θ−φ2)∣≤1∈L1(μ⊗ν),\abs{\sin^2\p{\frac{\theta - \phi}{2}}} \leq 1 \in L^1\p{\mu \otimes \nu},∣∣​sin2(2θ−φ​)∣∣​≤1∈L1(μ⊗ν),

it follows that FFF trivially attains its minimum on M\mathcal{M}M.
